question.title: Jenkins - Windows build agent automatically getting disconnected while archiving the artifact
question.body:
I am running a Jenkins controller on a Linux machine with OpenJDK 17.0.14, and my build agent is a Windows machine with OpenJDK 17.0.12. I have encountered an issue during the archiveArtifacts step in my Jenkins pipeline, where the build fails with a java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException.

On the Jenkins controller, the following error appears in the logs:

hudson.remoting.ProxyException: java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException at jenkins.agents.WebSocketAgents$Session.closed(WebSocketAgents.java:160) at jenkins.websocket.WebSockets$2.onWebSocketClose(WebSockets.java:105) at jenkins.websocket.Jetty12EE9Provider$2.onWebSocketClose(Jetty12EE9Provider.java:164) ...

At the same time, the agent logs indicate that the agent was automatically disconnected and then reconnected.

My setup is as follows: Jenkins Controller: Linux machine with OpenJDK 17.0.14

Jenkins Agent: Windows machine with OpenJDK 17.0.12

WebSocket communication is being used (-webSocket flag set)

Has anyone encountered a similar issue where the agent gets disconnected during the archiveArtifacts step? What could be causing the ClosedChannelException, and how can I resolve this?

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Ensured that both the Jenkins controller and agent are using compatible versions of Java (both are OpenJDK 17).

Checked network stability and confirmed that there are no issues with connectivity.

Reviewed Jenkins and agent logs, which show that the agent disconnects during the archive step and attempts to reconnect.
